text: I auditioned when I was nine.
And I started filming when I was sort of 10 or 11.
I mean, I guess it's just, yeah, very, very strange.
And especially like in this one, there's loads of flashbacks to the first film.
Um, so I get to see a lot of that.
I guess just,  I just seemed to have such chubby cheeks and such like a high voice- ...
and the big hair and, yeah, I-  Right.
I mean, it's kind of hard to explain like- ...
how that feels, but I guess like, I don't know, if you hear your voice on, if you ever hear your voice taped or an answering machine- ...
"Oh, that's horrible, people can't listen." It's exactly like that, but like 20 times worse.
Um, I was in Waitrose the other day and I came across Hermione's Magic Muffins, which I was like, "Wow, that's a new one." Yeah, yeah, exactly.
You don't have to buy any of the ingredients.
It's all in there, and you, you kind of get these little stickers with my head on them and you kind of put them on.
I'm a, I'm an awful cook.
I, I, I, um, I would never ever  do that.
Yeah, um, at the press junket they had like a room with the game that's been released and people could kind of go in and try it and stuff.

And my brother obviously was bored to tears, was listening to me talk about Harry Potter, went in, um, and was trying the game out, and he came back and I was like, "Oh, did you have a good morning?" He was like, "Yeah, yeah, yeah.
I've, um, I've been throwing benches at you, like for hours." And I was like, "Oh." So that's like, that's like, don't know.
I don't think I would let them- ...
I think that's so, like, no, that would be really weird.
Well, this is the funny thing.
By the time I'd had all the sort of etiquettes of how I was meant to meet her, and I could only say this and I couldn't say that.
To be honest, I was kind of glad in the end that I didn't actually meet her in the end.

'Cause like apparently, you know, um, you can only address her as Your Majesty, and you can't speak to her unless she speaks to you, and there's kind of this little bow you have to do, and all of this stuff that I was like, "Okay, right, okay." And, um, I was so nervous about it, I was kind of like, "Actually, you know what?
I'll just, I'll just look at her or just sit behind her, that's good enough for me, you know?" Yeah.
To be honest, she, I mean, I hope she enjoyed the show we put together.
She kind of, she didn't really, not that much facial expression going on.
I was like, "Is she enjoying it?
I mean, it's just kind of like, "Whoo, yeah!" No.
Yeah, no, so I was like, yeah, I didn't really know, but I'm sure she, I hope she enjoyed it.
When I come to America, I always feel really, I hate my English accent 'cause it sounds so kind of like, I don't know, pretentious?
I don't know if that's the word.
It sounds really kind of, I don't know.
So by the end of my stay here, I kind of find that my English is kind of edging towards American English actually.
You can always tell pretty much.
I mean, yeah, you can pretty much tell that- Yeah.
Well, I guess, I don't know how well we pull off American accents though, so, you know, think about it.
I have to say, I've watched it a couple of times.
I mean, it's like quintessentially British.
He's very, you know, very, very British.
I, I can't compete with this.
Rupert bought an ice cream truck.
I can never compete with this guy.

He actually said to me, he was like, he says to me quite seriously, he said, "If I hadn't got this, you know, if I hadn't become an actor, you know, I, I seriously would've considered being an ice cream man." I was like, "Okay, cool." Well, uh, so he's kind of like fulfilled both dreams, you know?
And as, and as, as well, it's not just like he's bought the truck to kind of drive around kind of for show.
It actually has all of the ice cream in it, all of like the little chocolate drops and everything.
It's- Well, yeah, but no-  Yeah, no, it's...
You have to have seen the last film.
And you have to know that, um, Ron was a complete idiot, to be fair.
He didn't invite her to the ball and then he made a really big deal about her going with someone else, and he completely ruined her evening and she ended up crying on, on the steps.
And then he never apologized and basically was just, you know.
So in this one, she, um, she kind of kicks his ass.
She really like gets her own back and, um, it's quite kind of a classic, uh, girl power moment.
